intro: Cupaniopsis remotidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, red or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces woody capsules that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The species is often found in coastal and inland regions of Western Australia.
